node.title: Material Property not defined on block
node.bodyText:
I was using the old crystal plasticity model in the MOOSE repository as found below and it was working but I found it was a depreciated code so I tried using the newer module suggested but I got an error.
Below is the deprecated model that worked:
  [file]
    type = FileMeshGenerator
    file = kks_multiphase_largescale_large_out.e-s183
    use_for_exodus_restart = true
  []
[]

[Variables]
  [disp_x]
  []
  [disp_y]
  []

  # order parameter 0
  [eta0]
    initial_from_file_var = eta1
  []
  # order parameter 1
  [eta1]
    initial_from_file_var = eta2
  []
  [eta2]
    initial_from_file_var = eta3
  []
[]

[AuxVariables]
  [vonmises]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
  []
  [stress_xx]
    order = CONSTANT
    family = MONOMIAL
    block = 0
  []
[]

[AuxKernels]
  [vonmises]
    type = RankTwoScalarAux
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    variable = vonmises
    scalar_type = VonMisesStress
    execute_on = timestep_end
    #   block = 0
  []
  [stress_xx]
    type = RankTwoAux
    rank_two_tensor = stress
    variable = stress_xx
    index_j = 0
    index_i = 0
    execute_on = timestep_end
    block = 0
  []
[]

[BCs]
  [symmy]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_y
    boundary = bottom
    value = 0
  []
  [symmx]
    type = DirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = left
    value = 0
  []
  [tdisp]
    type = FunctionDirichletBC
    variable = disp_x
    boundary = right
    function = '0.1*t'
  []
[]

[Materials]
  [elasticity_tensor_phase0]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
    C_ijkl = '1.684e5 1.214e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 0.754e5 0.754e5 0.754e5'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    base_name = phase0
    block = 0
  []
  [crysp_phase0]
    type = FiniteStrainCPSlipRateRes
    slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys.txt
    nss = 12
    num_slip_sys_flowrate_props = 2 #Number of properties in a slip system
    flowprops = '1 4 1e-6 0.05 5 8 1e-6 0.05 9 12 1e-6 0.05'
    hprops = '1.0 215 78.6 200.0 1.75'
    gprops = '1 4 78.6 5 8 78.6 9 12 78.6'
    slip_incr_tol = 1
    maximum_substep_iteration = 12
    rtol = 1e-9
    abs_tol = 1e-10
    base_name = phase0
  []
  [strain_phase0]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrain
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    base_name = phase0
    #    eigenstrain_names = eigenstrain2
  []

  [elasticity_tensor_phase1]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
    C_ijkl = '1.684e5 1.214e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 0.754e5 0.754e5 0.754e5'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    euler_angle_1 = 0.0
    euler_angle_2 = 45.0
    euler_angle_3 = 0.0
    base_name = phase1
  []
  [crysp_phase1]
    type = FiniteStrainCPSlipRateRes
    slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys.txt
    nss = 12
    num_slip_sys_flowrate_props = 2 #Number of properties in a slip system
    flowprops = '1 4 1e-6 0.05 5 8 1e-6 0.05 9 12 1e-6 0.05'
    hprops = '1.0 250 118.6 230.0 1.75'
    gprops = '1 4 118.6 5 8 118.6 9 12 118.6'
    slip_incr_tol = 1
    maximum_substep_iteration = 12
    rtol = 1e-9
    abs_tol = 1e-10
    base_name = phase1
  []
  [strain_phase1]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrain
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    base_name = phase1
  []

  [elasticity_tensor_phase2]
    type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
    C_ijkl = '1.684e5 1.214e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 0.754e5 0.754e5 0.754e5'
    fill_method = symmetric9
    euler_angle_1 = 0.0
    euler_angle_2 = 45.0
    euler_angle_3 = 30.0
    base_name = phase2
  []
  [crysp_phase2]
    type = FiniteStrainCPSlipRateRes
    slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys.txt
    nss = 12
    num_slip_sys_flowrate_props = 2 #Number of properties in a slip system
    flowprops = '1 4 1e-6 0.05 5 8 1e-6 0.05 9 12 1e-6 0.05'
    hprops = '1.0 250 118.6 230.0 1.75'
    gprops = '1 4 118.6 5 8 118.6 9 12 118.6'
    slip_incr_tol = 1
    maximum_substep_iteration = 12
    rtol = 1e-9
    abs_tol = 1e-10
    base_name = phase2
  []
  [strain_phase2]
    type = ComputeFiniteStrain
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    base_name = phase2
  []

  # Switching functions for each phase
  [h0]
    type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
    phase_etas = eta0
    all_etas = 'eta0 eta1 eta2'
    h_name = h0
  []
  [h1]
    type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
    phase_etas = eta1
    all_etas = 'eta0 eta1 eta2'
    h_name = h1
  []
  [h2]
    type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
    phase_etas = eta2
    all_etas = 'eta0 eta1 eta2'
    h_name = h2
  []

  # Generate the global stress from the phase stresses
  [global_stress]
    type = MultiPhaseStressMaterial
    phase_base = 'phase0 phase1 phase2'
    h = 'h0     h1     h2'
  []
[]

[Kernels]
  [eta0_dt]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = eta0
  []
  [eta1_dt]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = eta1
  []
  [eta2_dt]
    type = TimeDerivative
    variable = eta2
  []

  [TensorMechanics]
    displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
  []
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [vonmises]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = vonmises
    block = 'ANY_BLOCK_ID 0'
  []
  [stress_xx]
    type = ElementAverageValue
    variable = stress_xx
    block = 'ANY_BLOCK_ID 0'
  []
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [smp]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  []
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = 'PJFNK'

  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_package -snes_type'
  petsc_options_value = 'lu            superlu_dist          vinewtonrsls'

  #  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_asm_overlap -sub_pc_type -ksp_type -ksp_gmres_restart'
  #  petsc_options_value = ' asm      2              lu            gmres     200'
  l_max_its = 20
  nl_max_its = 10
  nl_rel_tol = 1.0e-8
  nl_abs_tol = 1.0e-9

  end_time = 300

  [TimeStepper]
    type = IterationAdaptiveDT
    dt = 5e-3
    cutback_factor = 0.75
    growth_factor = 1.2
    optimal_iterations = 20
  []
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  csv = true
[]

Below is the newer model:
[Mesh]
    [file]
        type = FileMeshGenerator
        file = my_kks_noload_twophase_out.e-s180
        use_for_exodus_restart = true
    []
[]


[Variables]
    [disp_x]
    []
    [disp_y]
    []

    # order parameter 0
    [eta0]
        initial_from_file_var = eta1
    []
    # order parameter 1
    [eta1]
        initial_from_file_var = eta3
    []
[]

[AuxVariables]
    [pk2]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
    []
    [fp_xx]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
    []
    [e_xx]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
    []
    [eta0_gss]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
        block = 0
    []
    [eta0_slip_increment]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
        block = 0
    []
    [eta1_gss]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
    []
    [eta1_slip_increment]
        order = CONSTANT
        family = MONOMIAL
    []
[]

[AuxKernels]
    [pk2]
        type = RankTwoAux
        variable = pk2
        rank_two_tensor = second_piola_kirchhoff_stress
        index_j = 2
        index_i = 2
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [fp_xx]
        type = RankTwoAux
        variable = fp_xx
        rank_two_tensor = plastic_deformation_gradient
        index_j = 2
        index_i = 2
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [e_xx]
        type = RankTwoAux
        variable = e_xx
        rank_two_tensor = total_lagrangian_strain
        index_j = 2
        index_i = 2
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [gss_eta0]
        type = MaterialStdVectorAux
        variable = eta0_gss
        property = eta0_slip_resistance
        index = 0
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [slip_inc_eta0]
        type = MaterialStdVectorAux
        variable = eta0_slip_increment
        property = eta0_slip_increment
        index = 0
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [gss_eta1]
        type = MaterialStdVectorAux
        variable = eta1_gss
        property = eta1_slip_resistance
        index = 0
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [slip_inc_eta1]
        type = MaterialStdVectorAux
        variable = eta1_slip_increment
        property = eta1_slip_increment
        index = 0
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
[]

[BCs]
    [symmy]
        type = DirichletBC
        variable = disp_y
        boundary = bottom
        value = 0
    []
    [symmx]
        type = DirichletBC
        variable = disp_x
        boundary = left
        value = 0
    []

    [tdisp]
        type = FunctionDirichletBC
        variable = disp_x
        boundary = right
        function = '0.01*t'
    []
[]

[Materials]
    [elasticity_tensor_eta0]
        type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
        C_ijkl = '1.684e5 1.214e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 0.754e5 0.754e5 0.754e5'
        fill_method = symmetric9
        base_name = eta0
    []
    [stress_eta0]
        type = ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress
        crystal_plasticity_models = 'trial_xtalpl_eta0'
        tan_mod_type = exact
    []
    [trial_xtalpl_eta0]
        type = CrystalPlasticityKalidindiUpdate
        number_slip_systems = 12
        slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys.txt
        base_name = eta0
    []
    [elasticity_tensor_eta1]
        type = ComputeElasticityTensorCP
        C_ijkl = '1.684e5 1.214e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 1.214e5 1.684e5 0.754e5 0.754e5 0.754e5'
        fill_method = symmetric9
        euler_angle_1 = 0.0
        euler_angle_2 = 45.0
        euler_angle_3 = 0.0
        base_name = eta1
    []
    [stress_eta1]
        type = ComputeMultipleCrystalPlasticityStress
        crystal_plasticity_models = 'trial_xtalpl_eta1'
        tan_mod_type = exact
    []
    [trial_xtalpl_eta1]
        type = CrystalPlasticityKalidindiUpdate
        number_slip_systems = 48
        slip_sys_file_name = input_slip_sys_bcc48.txt
        base_name = eta1
    []

    # Switching functions for each phase
    [h0]
        type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
        phase_etas = eta0
        all_etas = 'eta0 eta1'
        h_name = h0
    []
    [h1]
        type = SwitchingFunctionMultiPhaseMaterial
        phase_etas = eta1
        all_etas = 'eta0 eta1'
        h_name = h1
    []

    # Generate the global stress from the phase stresses
    
[]

[Kernels]
    [eta0_dt]
        type = TimeDerivative
        variable = eta0
    []
    [eta1_dt]
        type = TimeDerivative
        variable = eta1
    []
    [TensorMechanics]
        displacements = 'disp_x disp_y'
    []
[]

[Postprocessors]
    [pk2]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = pk2
    []
    [fp_xx]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = fp_xx
    []
    [e_xx]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = e_xx
    []
    [eta0_gss]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = eta0_gss
        block = 0
    []
    [eta0_slip_increment]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = eta0_slip_increment
        block = 0
    []
    [eta1_gss]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = eta1_gss
        block = 0
    []
    [eta1_slip_increment]
        type = ElementAverageValue
        variable = eta1_slip_increment
        block = 0
    []
    [dofs]
        type = NumDOFs
    []
[]

[Preconditioning]
    [smp]
        type = SMP
        full = true
    []
[]

[Executioner]
    type = Transient
    solve_type = 'PJFNK'

    petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -pc_factor_mat_solver_package -snes_type -pc_asm_overlap -sub_pc_type -ksp_type  -ksp_gmres_restart '
    petsc_options_value = ' lu            mumps            vinewtonrsls    2  lu    gmres  200 '
    l_max_its = 50
    nl_max_its = 25
    l_tol = 1.0e-3
    nl_rel_tol = 1.0e-6
    nl_abs_tol = 1.0e-8

    end_time = 100

    [TimeStepper]
        type = IterationAdaptiveDT
        dt = 5e-4
        cutback_factor = 0.8
        growth_factor = 1.2
        optimal_iterations = 20
    []

    [Adaptivity]
        initial_adaptivity = 0
        refine_fraction = 0.7
        coarsen_fraction = 0.1
        max_h_level = 1
    []
[]

[Preconditioning]
    active = 'full'
    [full]
        type = SMP
        full = true
    []
    [mydebug]
        type = FDP
        full = true
    []
[]

[Outputs]
    exodus = true
    print_linear_residuals = true
    [table]
        type = CSV
        execute_on = timestep_end
    []
    [checkpoint]
        type = Checkpoint
        num_files = 10
        time_step_interval = 10
    []
[]

[Debug]
    show_var_residual_norms = true
[]

Using EXPERIMENTAL Stateful Material Property projection with Adaptivity!

Seems there is only one block, called block 0
I don't see why it has a different name in the error message
In the old crystal plasticity material property I could add _base_name in the appropriate source codes and it worked but that seems not to work anymore.

I don't know that there should be a base name here
The requested properties do not have any prefix

When I start modifying the crystal plasticity model I do not encounter the problem when there is only one parameter say eta0, but Immediately I add eta1 I get the block ID error.
I used to get the same errors with this deprecated crystal plasticity model but the "_base_name +" in the source code resolved it.

Don't use this really old crystal plasticity model (FiniteStrainCPSlipRateRes). Please use the newer CrystalPlasticityKalidindiUpdate model you were using before. Be cognizant of the fact that this Kalidindi model is developed only for FCC materials and cannot accept 48 slip systems for a BCC material. You will also need to add the base_name parameter to the strain calculators.
I recommend using the [Physics/SolidMechanics/QuasiStatic] action. See this regression test for any example: https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/modules/solid_mechanics/test/tests/crystal_plasticity/stress_update_material_based/bicrystal_test.i

node.title: Anisotropic Mobility Kernel Object Not Found
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I am very new to both MOOSE and Phase Field modeling so I need some help! I am trying to solve a simple split Cahn-Hilliard equation. With a slightly different anisotropic mobility. The new mobility is a linear combination of two tensor inputs k_ani and k_iso: k_ani * alpha + k_iso * (1-alpha). To learn how to edit an object file I created a material property and even got this new mobility to work on a simple diffusion problem.
#include "AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial.h"

registerMooseObject("MooseApp", AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial);

InputParameters
AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial::validParams()
{
  InputParameters params = Material::validParams();
  params.addClassDescription("Anisotropic diffusion tensor material with linear combination: K = K_ani*alpha + K_iso*(1-alpha), where alpha(x) = frac{x-x_min}{x_max-x_min})");
  params.addRequiredParam<RealTensorValue>("tensor_anisotropic", "Anisotropic tensor (K_ani)");
  params.addRequiredParam<RealTensorValue>("tensor_isotropic", "Isotropic tensor (K_iso)");
  params.addRequiredParam<Real>("x_min", "Minimum x-coordinate value");
  params.addRequiredParam<Real>("x_max", "Maximum x-coordinate value");
  return params;
}

AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial::AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial(const InputParameters & parameters)
  : Material(parameters),
    _K_ani(getParam<RealTensorValue>("tensor_anisotropic")),
    _K_iso(getParam<RealTensorValue>("tensor_isotropic")),
    _x_min(getParam<Real>("x_min")),
    _x_max(getParam<Real>("x_max")),
    _K(declareProperty<RealTensorValue>("K"))
{
}

void
AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial::computeQpProperties()
{
  Real x = _q_point[_qp](0) ;
  Real alpha = (x - _x_min) / (_x_max - _x_min);
  _K[_qp] = _K_ani * alpha + _K_iso * (1 - alpha);
}
#pragma once

#include "Material.h"

class AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial : public Material
{
public:
  AnisotropicSumDiffusionMaterial(const InputParameters & parameters);
  static InputParameters validParams();
protected:
  virtual void computeQpProperties() override;
private:
  const RealTensorValue & _K_ani;
  const RealTensorValue & _K_iso;
  const Real & _x_min;
  const Real & _x_max;
  MaterialProperty<RealTensorValue> & _K;
};
This object, however, does not work in my app once applied to an edited SplitCHWRes which is only changed to intake the new _K.
#include "TensorSumSplitCHWRes.h"

registerMooseObject("MarmotApp", TensorSumSplitCHWRes);

InputParameters
TensorSumSplitCHWRes::validParams()
{
  InputParameters params = SplitCHWResBase::validParams();
  params.addClassDescription("Split formulation Cahn-Hilliard Kernel for the chemical potential "
                             "Tensor sum from anisotropic mobility input");
  return params;
}

TensorSumSplitCHWRes::TensorSumSplitCHWRes(const InputParameters & parameters) 
  : SplitCHWResBase(parameters),
    _K(getMaterialProperty<RealTensorValue>("K")) 
{
}
#pragma once

#include "Material.h"
#include "SplitCHWResBase.h"
#include "RankTwoTensor.h"

/**
 * TensorSumSplitCHWRes creates the residual for the chemical
 * potential in the split form of the Cahn-Hilliard
 * equation with a tensorial mobility.
 */

class TensorSumSplitCHWRes : public SplitCHWResBase<Real>
{
public:
  TensorSumSplitCHWRes(const InputParameters & parameters);

  static InputParameters validParams();

protected:
  // virtual Real computeQpResidual() override;

  const MaterialProperty<RealTensorValue> & _K;
};

Hello, I want to add damage to the hill plasticity (HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate) through the PF nonconserved action. From what I understand I need to define the new degraded stress and its derivatives and the free energy and its derivatives (dstress_dc, F, dFdc, d2Fdc2,  d2Fdcdstrain).    32 |     _dstress_dc(declarePropertyDerivative<RankTwoTensor>(_base_name + "stress", coupledName("c", 0))),
      |                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
      |                 declarePropertyByName

I also don't see in which of the inherited class is the elastic strain called: I see that HillElastoPlas. inherits from the RadialReturnStressUpdate (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/RadialReturnStressUpdate.html) which should have _elastic_strain_old[_qp] but it's also not declared with the error showing as : error: '_elastic_strain_old' was not declared in this scope;.

You may have to use the using syntax to see the  _elastic_strain_old attribute from the parent class

though I did include the DerivativeMaterialInterface class

what does the class definition look like?

I figured it out, thanks ! Now my question is regarding how the HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate and the ComputeMultipleInelasticStress are correlated. I see from the diagram in https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/materials/ComputeMultipleInelasticStress.html that the trial irreversible stress is computed in HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate, so this is the stress_new in HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate ? and the final stress is the stress in ComputeFiniteStrainElasticStress ?

Can we use both the HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate and ComputeCrackedStress together? I keep getting error messages, is it due to a wrong input file or are we not supposed to use them together? Thanks!

So now if I want to degrade the material properties by affecting the degradation function (from CrackedStress) to the yield stress (from HillElastoPlasticity). To do that I'm "getting" the c from ComputeCrackedStress to HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate. But now I'm getting this error
*** ERROR ***
Cyclic dependency detected in object ordering:
elastic_strain <- cracked_stress <- elastic_strain

I don't think I understand what this means

This means the objects (the material properties computed by each material) depend on each other in a circular fashion. We need one to compute the other, but the other needs the first one to be computed. The dependencies should not form a cycle
Ok so I can't couple these two together because they are both being called by ComputeMultipleInelasticStress

This part should be fine. They can both be depended on by a 3rd material
they just cant depend both on each other
But I'm only trying to have HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate depend on CrackedStress and not the other way around.
in the code for the crackedStress you are using the elastic_strain. If you dont want that, then change that code

In cracked stress I want to use the elastic strain to calculate the free energy. What I want is to be able to use the damage variable ("c" from CrackedStressed) in HillElastoPlasticity to degrade the yield stress

can you use the property from the previous time step? with getMaterialPropertyOld
this will break the circle of dependencies
I tried that and still got the same error
what did you change?

In ComputeCrackedStress I added
_dam(declareProperty<Real>(_uncracked_base_name + "dam")),
with _dam[_qp] = _c[_qp];
and in HillElastoPlasticity:
_dam(this->template getGenericMaterialProperty<Real, is_ad>(this->_base_name + "dam")),
_dam_old(this->template getMaterialPropertyOld<Real>(this->_base_name + "dam")),

with the new yield stress:
      _yield_stress  =   _yield_stress * ( 1 - _dam_old[_qp]) * ( 1 - _dam_old[_qp]);

Hi, another question concerning HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate, the eq_plastic_strain_inc doesn't return the usual equivalent plastic strain?

as it's also defined and called in FiniteStrainPlasticMaterial
_inc stands for increment. So it's not the full value of strain, only the difference over a time step

_effective_inelastic_strain[_qp] = _effective_inelastic_strain_old[_qp] + eq_plastic_strain_inc;
But even when accumulated it doesn't return the same values as the equivalent plastic strain
@gambka
@singhgp4321 is better suited to answer this question.

The definition of the effective plastic strain might be different from other objects. There is a report and references on this set of anisotropic objects.
I would look in the references and change things if one wants to have the same definition.
Thanks all, I added it manually 👍

Hello,
My main objective is to integrate damage into Hill anisotropic plasticity. So first, I attempted to use HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate in combination with ComputeCrackedStress and ComputeMultipleInelasticStress. My approach involved degrading the yield stress in HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate using the damage_old parameter from ComputeCrackedStress. However, this resulted in an abnormal increase in plastic strain once the yield stress was reached. In another attempt, I incorporated the phase field formulation into ComputeMultipleInelasticStress by defining the degraded stress and its derivatives, along with the free energy and its derivatives (dstress_dc, F, dFdc, d2Fdc2, d2Fdcdstrain). Unfortunately, this also produced incorrect results, showing the same abnormal surge in plastic strain.
I suspect the error originates from ComputeMultipleInelasticStress, but I am unsure where to look exactly. Do you have any suggestions? Thanks!

@nourshabib I am trying to understand the specifics of your damage model and how you are trying to use it alongside HillElastoPlasticity. Is there a document on your damage model that you could point me to?
There can be several reasons for getting unusually high plastic strain. Is your damage parameter showing reasonable values, same thing about the yield stress after the onset of damage? I will first ensure that the damage parameter is not jumping to an abruptly high value, or the yield stress is not dropping down too fast. If that is not the case then I will need to look into the code that everything looks fine there.

Phase field for fracture in ductile material so I want to include a plastic free energy term in the free energy formulation (specifically the 'yield stress * the equivalent plastic strain * the degradation function' in the free energy formula ) and degrade the yield stress (degradation function * yield_stress), as in "A phase-field formulation for fracture in ductile materials: Finite deformation balance law derivation, plastic degradation, and stress triaxiality effects": https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0045782516311069, haven't seen this done with Hill plasticity, but it shouldn't be  that different from the von mises plasticity. The unusually high plastic strain thus leads to the high damage values and the sharp decrease in stress.
What I've done:

In HillElastoPlasticityStressUpdate I added the degradation function (1-c)^2 and affected it to the yield stress : yield_stress * (1-c)^2
In ComputeCrackedStress I added the plastic free energy term to the free energy and its derivatives as : yield_stress *  eqv_plastic_strain * (1-c)^2

And this lead to high plastic strain, sharp increase in damage and sharp stress decrease.

I was trying to follow the steps listed in  https://mooseframework.inl.gov/python/MooseControl/index.html to get a taste of it. But I cannot seem to get it working since I don't know how to set my file_socket parameter.

This is a very recent feature. Which version of moose (which commit) are you using?

I am using the newest version (2024.06.17)
@loganharbour

If you're using the MooseControl python object, you don't need to set the port or file socket. It's done for you internally by the script.
Within the MooseControl object, you specify the name of the WebServerControl object in your input file. It uses this name to take care of the port/file socket for you via a command line argument.

node.bodyText:
Check these boxes if you have followed the posting rules.

 Q&A Getting Started is the most appropriate category for my question (trouble installing, beginner user, ...)
 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (avoid screenshots if possible, triple back quotes before/after pasted text, etc)

Issue or question about MOOSE
Dear mooseusers,
I try to run an example, it shows the objects not registered.
The example is:
[Mesh]

[]

the error is : A 'ADStateful' is not a registered object.
I am writing to ask is there some modules not included when I compile moose?
my makefile is:
###############################################################################
################### MOOSE Application Standard Makefile #######################
###############################################################################

Optional Environment variables
MOOSE_DIR        - Root directory of the MOOSE project

###############################################################################
Use the MOOSE submodule if it exists and MOOSE_DIR is not set
MOOSE_SUBMODULE    := $(CURDIR)/moose
ifneq ($(wildcard $(MOOSE_SUBMODULE)/framework/Makefile),)
MOOSE_DIR        ?= $(MOOSE_SUBMODULE)
else

framework

################################## MODULES ####################################
To use certain physics included with MOOSE, set variables below to
yes as needed.  Or set ALL_MODULES to yes to turn on everything (overrides
other set variables).

MISC                        := no

PERIDYNAMICS                := no
PHASE_FIELD                 := yes

###############################################################################

APPLICATION_NAME   := puppy
BUILD_EXEC         := yes
GEN_REVISION       := no
include            $(FRAMEWORK_DIR)/app.mk

Thank you for your help.
Best regards,
Xiao
Diagnostics for MOOSE installation issues
[Optional] Output of the diagnostics scripts. To run the script: cd ~/projects/moose/scripts; ./diagnostics.sh

Hello
ADStateful is a moose test object. It is not supposed to be used in calculations outside of tests.
It is not part of any module. It can be included but it's a bit of work and not just in the Makefile.
Maybe just move it to your app if you need it (and change the register object call in the source file)
Guillaume

Thank you for answering. I still have one question; recently, I tried to run a test from others, and it has some errors for missing files.

is this the file not compiled from the beginning of installing the software? I could find these files in the moose class index
Thank you for your help in this.
Best regards,
Xiao

node.bodyText:

 I have consulted the posting Guidelines on the Discussions front page
 I have searched the Discussions forum and my question has not been asked before
 I have searched the MOOSE website and the documentation does not answer my question
 I have formatted my post following the posting guidelines (avoid screenshots if possible, triple back quotes before/after pasted text, etc)

Issue or question about MOOSE
All,
I got the error message during updating MOOSE repository as:
~/projects/moose$ git rebase origin/master
First, rewinding head to replay your work on top of it...
error: Updating the following directories would lose untracked files in them:
modules/tensor_mechanics/src
Aborting
fatal: Could not detach HEAD
It seems this kind of error was discussed in "Fatal" warning during MOOSE update #26465.
I have the "tensor_mechanics" in the module directory and the "update_and_rebuild_wasp.sh" the scrips directory.  What am I supposed to do then? Please help. S. Thomas
Diagnostics for MOOSE installation issues
[Optional] Output of the diagnostics scripts. To run the script: cd ~/projects/moose/scripts; ./diagnostics.sh

Hello
We deleted that module.
Move any work you have in that module into the solid mechanics module. Either manually, or with git mv in the first commit adding the new files
Guillaume

Thank you, Guillaume.
Now, with "conda create -n moose moose-dev=2024.05.13"
The action shown in the attached has been going on overnight.
I don't know what to do. Please help.

This usually happens when your instance of Conda is using the deprecated solver. Newer versions are using libmamba. Can you cancel that (ctrl-c), and run the following:
conda list | grep conda
Once we see whats there, we can continue appropriately.
Thank you. Please see below.

Sorry for the delay... Yeah it looks like you are running an old version of Conda. If Conda will let you, try to upgrade it:
conda update conda
If you do not see conda being updated to 23.11.x, we will need to be a bit more aggressive with it. Which is usually the case. If so, you can try to force a newer version with:
conda install conda=25
Once you have a version >=23.11, then try to create the moose environment:
conda create -n moose moose-dev=2024.05.11

So, I did "conda update conda" (see below)


But, "grep list | grep conda" shows still 23.1.0 (see below)

So, I did "conda install conda=25" and got the following

Also, I tried "conda install conda=24.5.0" as suggested in the first printout above and it did something (see the last part of printout)

BNut  "grep list | grep conda" show the same 23.1.0 (see below).

I would advise to just delete the conda directory and download it again
then conda update conda should work
Also, if you can, please do not post images of text. WSL text windows are capable of being copy pasted like any other terminal window; mouse select, right-click usually does the trick.

Do you mean do "rm -r conda" in the /projects/moose directory
and follow the instructions of Conda MOOSE Environment of installing MOOSE from Getting Started
(install to my home directory - not in the /projects/moose directory)?
Please let me know.

If you put the (mini)conda directory there then yes
We expect that (mini)conda directory to be under the home directory iirc

With the base environment loaded:
conda deactivate
conda activate base
You can get the installation directory by then running:
echo $CONDA_PREFIX
This will be the directory you want to remove.
We may run into an initialization issue after installing a newer version of Conda, but we will deal with that when/if it happens. Regardless, once you remove the directory above, please follow our Conda Installation Instructions to obtain the latest version available.
And if installation proceeds well, next follow the section of Installing MOOSE (conda create -n moose moose-dev=2024.05.13).
